thread.title: Heat-Spurs preview: San Antonio Spurs at Miami Heat
thread.title_full: Heat-Spurs preview: San Antonio Spurs at Miami Heat - Sun Sentinel

author: Ira Winderman
title: Heat-Spurs preview: San Antonio Spurs at Miami Heat
text:
When/Where: 7:30 p.m., AmericanAirlines Arena.
Tickets: Available at HEAT.com or 1-800-4NBA-TIX.
TV: Fox Sports Sun. Radio: 790-AM, 106.3-FM, 710-AM (Spanish).
Scouting report: The Heat enter 0-2 in the preseason, with this opening a back-to-back exhibition set that concludes Tuesday in Orlando . . . The Heat lost both of their regular-season games against the Spurs last season by double digits, with the teams again to meet twice this season . . . As always, it likely will come down to game-time decisions as to which Spurs veterans are in the lineup. Not only did Tim Duncan, Tony Parker, Manu Ginobili and Boris Diaw not make the trip when the Spurs opened their preseason in Sacramento, but coach Gregg Popovich also bypassed that trip, as well . . . The Spurs return with their veteran core intact, augmented by the offseason additions of free-agent forwards LaMarcus Aldridge and David West . . . Former Heat forward Rasual Butler is locked in a battle with Jimmer Fredette for a final San Antonio roster spot . . . The Spurs again feature former WNBA star Becky Hammon as an assistant coach . . . Center Hassan Whiteside (calf) is questionable for the Heat, after missing the first two exhibitions.
-- Ira Winderman
 San Antonio Spurs Miami Heat Manu Ginobili LaMarcus Aldridge Tony Parker Jimmer Fredette Rasual Butler
